info.title: FHIR CarePlan resource API documentation
info.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources (FHIR, pronounced "Fire") defines a set of "Resources" that represent granular clinical concepts. The resources can be managed in isolation, or aggregated into complex documents. Technically, FHIR is designed for the web; the resources are based on simple XML or JSON structures, with an http-based RESTful protocol where each resource has predictable URL. Where possible, open internet standards are used for data representation.

get.description:
Returns CarePlans based on filter criteria OR Provides provision for pagination (stateid, page, page_size, _pretty & _bundletype are query parameters used for Paging).

FHIR documentation for CarePlan.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Specify access token for API in the given format: Bearer [access_token].

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The Accept request-header field can be used to specify certain media types which are acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: _format
parameters.description: Format of data to be returned.

parameters.name: _content
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's data using a fulltext search

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: The resource identity

parameters.name: _language
parameters.description: The resource language

parameters.name: _lastUpdated
parameters.description: Only return resources which were last updated as specified by the given range. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: _profile
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given profile

parameters.name: _security
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given security labels

parameters.name: _tag
parameters.description: Search for resources which have the given tag

parameters.name: _text
parameters.description: Search the contents of the resource's narrative using a fulltext search

parameters.name: activitycode
parameters.description: Detail type of activity

parameters.name: activitydate
parameters.description: Specified date occurs within period specified by CarePlan.activity.timingSchedule. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: activityreference
parameters.description: Activity details defined in specific resource

parameters.name: condition
parameters.description: Health issues this plan addresses

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Time period plan covers. The date parameter format is yyyy-mm-ddThh:nn:ss(TZ). The prefixes >, >=, <= and < may be used on the parameter value.

parameters.name: goal
parameters.description: Desired outcome of plan

parameters.name: participant
parameters.description: Who is involved

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Who care plan is for

parameters.name: performer
parameters.description: Matches if the practitioner is listed as a performer in any of the "simple" activities.  (For performers of the detailed activities, chain through the activitydetail search parameter.)

parameters.name: relatedcode
parameters.description: includes | replaces | fulfills

parameters.name: relatedcode-relatedplan
parameters.description: A combination of the type of relationship and the related plan

parameters.name: relatedplan
parameters.description: Plan relationship exists with

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Who care plan is for

put.description:
The conditional update interaction is used to update an existing CarePlan based on some identification criteria, rather than by logical id.

delete.description:
The conditional delete interaction allows a client to delete CarePlan/CarePlans based on some selection criteria, rather than by a specific logical id.

post.description:
This interaction searches a set of CarePlans based on some filter criteria. Search interactions take a series of parameters of name'='value pairs encoded as an application/x-www-form-urlencoded submission for a POST.
